content:
I know that many of you have already escaped 2020 and are reveling in the new year. In Minnesota, we still have another 6 hours and 45 minutes to go.

@Tuhin spent the first few hours of the new year on our DEV call today. Very nice!

Best wishes to all. In Deerwood, Minnesota we're having a small bonfire with my parents, my sister, and my nephew. I'm told that for the sake of my nephew, we should expect the New Year to officially happen at 8:00PM tonight. ;-)
Fair warning: 10 hours into the new year and 2021 feels like a lot like any other day in 2020 :smiling_face:
Dang, @BWPanda - I was just about to ask you if you were noticing any improvements.
Well, I guess we'll just have to give 2021 some time to settle in.
Nah, the opposite in fact. Went to the supermarket this morning and it was shut! :laughing:
Oh, no. So your saying that Grocery stores are closed in 2021. I didn't stock up!
Lucky we have all those turkeys wandering around outside our windows.
still 2020 here. still sucks. i hope the local folks made some improvements to the new one when it shows
My dad just started shooting fireworks at 6:10pm. I think he is trying to entice us to come outside. It's only 21 degrees out there.

I haven't seen the pull request for 2021, so I have no idea what the code looks like ...and there were no Tugboat sandboxes to test it properly ...no change records either AFAICT :shrug: ...but people seem to be merging it to their repos based on their timezone.
...I'll treat it as a beta product for now.
...they say that there is a contrib module called Vaccine, which is meant to improve the UX, but I haven't tested it yet ...I think I'll wait for others to test and post some reviews first.
You about to hit midnight @StPaulTim ?
I am an hour past midnight and so far the new year has been pretty smooth.
So, I can officially wish everyone a Happy New Year now.
